name: Revela
about: At our pet-friendly, eco-conscious apartments in Mountain View, CA, we strive to cultivate a strong community atmosphere. Contact us today!Our brand-new Mountain View apartments offer pet-friendly, smoke-free, and eco-conscious homes, ideal for people who expect more than their living experience. To foster a strong sense of community, we host many events, from wine nights, taco Tuesdays, and sporting events to outdoor movie nights, game nights, and seasonal resident celebrations. For our most physically active residents we also offer the Revela running club, a bike club, and a hiking club. Learn more about the home and lifestyle awaiting you within our community when you reach out to the leasing team today.
Revela is an apartment located in Santa Clara County, the 94043 ZIP Code, and the Cupertino Union attendance zone.
features: Launch: High-Tech Central Plaza Gathering Area
Modern Appliances with Stainless Steel Finishings
Prep: Community Kitchenette and Gathering Spaces
Studio, One-, Two- and Three-Bedroom Floor Plans
Two Courtyards with Outdoor Kitchens and Lounges

(Translated by Google) Wonderful neighborhood

(Original)
Quartiere meraviglioso
High end and New construction, nice CM!

We’ve been living here for a little bit more than a month and fire alarm went off 6 times(4 times in one building, 2 in Revela 2 during the night). Before moving in we asked leasing office about it(we read reviews), and they said that it only happened once and very rare
Upd: another alarm happened next month at 1 am.
Amenities are very nice.

review_text.full_html: Amenities are unparalleled and the management is very attentive and organized.

Really a lovely place!!!  Revela is a very new community (2019?) and all facilities: gym, pool, unit, BBQ are in excellent condition.  It is a bit distant from groceries but you get very quiet neighborhood,  little traffic, excellent walking around. The management team is the best I've experienced: very friendly, always willing to help. During Covid I had to WFH, went to the study room to try the public printer, the office manager offered to use her printer for me right away; first week moved in, I locked myself out in the night,  called the afterhour # they showed up in 7 minutes!... They do a great job to keep the place clean and safe. If I could  I would live there forever.

review_text.full_html: I moved out about 2 months ago, and still haven’t gotten my security deposit back. Despite having sent multiple emails and having called several times each week, the management doesn’t respond 98% of the time. When they do pick up my call, they fail to give any conclusive answer on whether the security deposit check has been mailed or not and what amount I will be returned. Instead I’m told to follow up with accounting department and post office with absolutely no tracking details or even an indication on whether the check has been mailed or not. They refuse to provide any details on the amount returned as well. This is a ridiculous wait with little to no details provided, and being told to follow up with random departments!!
review_text.snippet_html: I moved out about 2 months ago, and still haven’t gotten my security deposit back. Despite having sent multiple emails and having called several times each week, the management doesn’t respond 98% of the time. When they do pick up my call, …

review_text.full_html:
AVOID THIS PLACE!!

Don’t bother to spend $3500+ per month for an awful experience. No matter how much concession they offer, they will take it back from you.
I lived here for 17 months and it’s the worst rental experience ever.

1. Say bye to your security deposit(And pay more):

They basically rob you when you move out with their corporate shenanigan.

Even after I throughly cleaned and emptied the whole unit, they charge me $300 for “professional cleaning”. I argued with them through email and they said they must perform this to turn the unit back to its INITIAL CONDITION. Yeah they basically expect you to pay rents for 1.5 years without living in the unit.

I hesitated to hang arts/mirrors in my apartment, so I talked to the leasing office before doing any drill. They say they WON’T CHARGE ME as long as I patch the holes. OK then I did some hanging and patched all the holes before moving out. TADA, they charge me $500 for wall painting!!! Even though holes are patched, they need to repaint the whole unit. What about the leasing office’s initial promise? They replied “We are so sorry for the miscommunication”.

2. Say bye to your sleep.

10+ false fire alarms (several ones happened after midnight) with 0 remedy.

Expect to have pajamas party with your neighbors after midnight outside the building to wait for the alarm to end.

The building’s insulation is the also a joke. You won’t miss any footstep from your neighbor upstairs. Be ready to wake up at 3:00AM with the creak and noise from your neighbors’ bed.

3. Greystar Nightmare

I signed my contract with Alliance but then Revela was transferred to Greystar. Search “Greystar Nightmare” and you will see how “Great” this company is.

They knock you out of the gym and ban your access because you left the gym later then they expected. As if they are the people who pay for the amenities.

The leasing office become much less responsive after the transfer and the past Alliance community manager (Lily) was doing a much better job than the current Greystar one.

Don’t bother to spend $3500+ per month for an awful experience. No matter how …

review_text.full_html: Revela checks all the boxes for comfort of living.
New apartments. Very well managed. Friendly staff. Close to VTA , parks and shopping centers.

Living here is like a nightmare!
Worst and most unprofessional management ever!
All the previous bad reviews are real.
You can't even imagine how bad it is to live in this apartment complex. Management are bullies, you pay sooo much money for the worst place ever.

Please do NOT consider living at Revela, it's awful, you will have a really bad experience.

Living here is like a nightmare!

All the previous bad reviews are real. …

review_text.full_html:
Short version:
Living spaces and amenities are generally decent and fine. Management is incompetent, petty, and does not care at all about tenants.

Longer version:
I lived here with one roommate in a 2bed/2bath unit on a year long lease, June 2020 - 2021. The first week we moved in, we noticed that the AC system was not working properly - air was not flowing into the master bedroom. We put in a maintenance request, after which management tried to convince us that nothing was actually wrong, this is just the way it's supposed to work. Since this response is clearly ridiculous, we asked that an external AC repair technician be brought in to take a look. Unsurprisingly, the technician identified in less than 10 minutes that the unit had a faulty motor that needed replacement. Revela then proceeded to take more than 5 months to get this repair done; nearly half the lease gone by without a basic feature that we pay rent for. When we asked management to provide some sort of compensation for this (keeping in mind the entirety of the summer months had passed by, peak AC usage season), they once again reverted to the stance that nothing was ever wrong with the AC and that the repair job was on us for asking for an upgrade to the unit. When we tried to escalate this complaint to regional management, they brushed it off and just said we're free to terminate the lease at any point if we want (and pay an additional 2 months rent as fee for doing so).

Some other reasons to avoid Revela specifically:

- Building fire alarms are constantly going off. Over the course of a year living here, the alarm was triggered at least 10 times, which forces you to leave the building because the siren is so loud. Revela management took no real steps to addressing this besides a few template mass emails, and actually even tried to shift the blame towards residents by stating that the front doors of units should not be used for helping to air out the kitchen.
- Indifferent attitude towards theft occurring on Revela property. My roommate had his bike stolen from the supposedly secure key-access bike room in the garage. Management took no action besides a bland "apology" email, and took several weeks more to access security footage from cameras in the garage.
- Terrible communication and responsiveness. The leasing office has stated hours of 9am-6pm most days, but good luck trying getting hold of a real person when needed. 4 out of 5 times I call the office (during business hours) no one answers, and half the time if you physically go to the office during the day no one is around. This could be written off as just unlucky on my part, since they claim to do leasing tours during the day and are sometimes unavailable, but this was my consistent experience from a full year of living there, so interpret that however you want. If you try to avoid this headache by utilizing email instead, you will still have difficulty. Unless you have a basic question or request that takes no effort to resolve, responses could take over a week to arrive (this was the case when trying to get our AC fixed). Completely ridiculous for people who are supposedly full-time "community managers".
- Unnecessary "valet trash service" fees. This is $50/month for someone to take bags from your door to the trash room down the hall. You can't opt out, even if you live next door to the trash room where it's actually faster and more convenient to just throw things out yourself. Plus, if you use the service and don't put your bin back inside the apartment in time, management threatens you with additional fees.

review_text.full_html: Delivery food

Live here. 10+ alarms since moved in, very hard to deal with anyone from management after signing the initial lease. They are all acting like I'm a disturbance to their daily routine. $60+ for trash each month for one of the smallest 1br apartments, $150+ in total over various utilities (I turn on the A/C only twice a year) that they don't share how they're calculated.
review_text.snippet_html: Live here. 10+ alarms since moved in, very hard to deal with anyone from management after signing the initial lease. They are all acting like I'm a disturbance to their daily routine. $60+ for trash each month for one of the smallest 1br …

review_text.full_html:
I have lived at the Revela apartments for a year and a half. There are many "luxury" apartment communities in Mountain View - don't move here.

Over the course of my time here there have been numerous issues that remain unaddressed:

* Increasing number of aggressive/rude/loud guests and/or tenants. There was an incident where I was walking my dog in front of the building a month ago and a woman pulled into two spaces very deliberately and double parked. There were a large number of spaces available and it bothered me. When I asked her if she really needed two spaces, the woman proceeded to tell me that she would "knock me down" and that I "would live longer if I kept my mouth shut". I notified management and they never followed up.
On another incident there was a group of people who were very loudly going through the hallway - so much so that they could be very clearly heard even over my television. They passed a second time as noisily as the first and I poked my head out my door to ask that they keep it down. They responded with "it's the f***ing weekend". Nice.
* Frequent loud fire alarms. Prior to moving here if I had been notified of this I don't know that I would have taken it as seriously as it should be. But once you move in, it becomes a very real inconvenience. Ask yourself if several times a month you'd like a meeting interrupted by an extremely loud fire alarm blaring. What if you're in the shower? 4am? It doesn't matter. It happens all the time and in a year and a half has never been due to an actual fire. It is almost always someone opening their front door when they're cooking or someone smoking too near the building. Many tenants choose not to exit their units now when these alarms go off. Heard of alarm fatigue? This is a significant safety concern as if there is in fact a real fire at some point, people may not take the alarm seriously anymore. Management offers no solutions.
* Lazy management team. This applies to the majority of the office staff. I can't say how many times I've been told that a staff member doesn't know the answer to a question and needs to defer to the property manager. Prepare for a very long wait if he happens to be on vacation. If you email them with a concern expect a very dismissive reply.
* Noise. Walls really are paper thin. I constantly hear my upstairs neighbors arguing late at night or talking on the phone at the top of their voice on their balcony.
* Random people constantly following tenants into building. We have a call system that is rarely used. I've refused entry to a stranger only for my neighbor to allow the person in.
* Stranger walked into my apartment. The lock system on the doors make it difficult to confirm the front door is locked from the inside. If you attempt to turn the handle, the door will open whether it is locked or not. Unfortunately, this meant that a stranger mistook my apartment for another's and walked right in.
Update: I have now paid thousands of dollars to be released from my lease contract. Beware anyone planning on moving here.
I also identified construction damage to one of the countertops that the apartments are now stating they will charge me for if they are not able to remove. I clearly demonstrated that a person is not capable of causing this damage and that it had to be a machine. Because I missed it during my move-in inspection they are insisting I am liable for it. Do not expect these people to do the decent thing if you have a problem here. They do the bare minimum to rent out the apartments and couldn't care less after you move in. Expect robotic, scripted responses if you have a problem. Can't wait to leave!
review_text.snippet_html: I have lived at the Revela apartments for a year and a half.  There are many "luxury" apartment communities in Mountain View - don't move here. …

review_text.full_html: Middle of the night fire alarms? Not cool.

Unbelievable. Fire alarm at 3AM. Stood outside for 25 minutes. Finally cleared. Went back to bed for 20 minutes. Fire alarm went off again at 4AM!

No email was sent the next day. No apology. No action taken.

Terrible management of such a nice looking and new apartment building.
review_text.snippet_html: Unbelievable. Fire alarm at 3AM. Stood outside for 25 minutes. Finally cleared. Went back to bed for 20 minutes. Fire alarm went off again at 4AM! …

review_text.full_html:
Edit 3: 2X alarms in last 10 days and now they are investigating "sensitivity" of fire alarms according to management email. Persistent issue since last year and yet they do not care.

Edit 2: *deducted a star on 1/14/2021* Horrible fire alarm last night at 11:00 PM. It’s insane that this apartment has not fixed this issue yet and is totally unacceptable. You can scroll down the reviews and see this recurring issue since last year. It’s unimaginable if you have kids or pets.

Edit 1: *Another fire alarm on 1/21/2021* in afternoon and this time during a work zoom call. Seriously this is just embarrassing and keeps getting better. This apartment management is quick to complain about you if there is a random noise from your home but yet won’t fix this absurd alarm issue. Save yourself and avoid this place.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Apartments are very modern and the community is beautifully maintained. Been living here since October and my experience has been okay. Here are some pros and cons:

Pros:
1) The leasing process was smooth albeit some minor hiccups but the team is really good and they are quick to address concerns.
2) Apartments are relatively new and the premises are well maintained.

Cons:
1) Package delivery is horrendous and the worst I’ve ever seen in an apartment complex which thrives to be modern. There are lockers present (paid) but so far my deliveries have either been at the lockers; in the floor at locker room; mailroom; or doorstep. For every delivery it’s a constant struggle to figure out where your package would have been left. And good luck walking to the parcel room if you live far away from leasing office.
2) The location is pretty dead with major business all 2-3 miles away.
3) I read the reviews about alarms but it only happened once since I moved in here. The management did send an email next day about the alarm.
4) You will pretty much be locked with 1 key per lease. The key fobs can’t be duplicated. I work at a hospital night shifts and have my girlfriend visiting on weekends and they wouldn’t issue an extra key after talks with “higher management”. I had to start a new lease agreement for my girlfriend who lives 250 miles away so she can visit me on weekends. This is absurd and unacceptable.
5) I constantly hear upstairs and adjacent neighbors sometimes even during quiet hours. Not ideal if you have worked a long shift and just want to sleep.

To summarize, this apartment tries to solve issues by creating even more unneeded issues. So far my experience has been underwhelming when compared to other luxury rentals in Mountain View. I will keep updating this review during my stay.
review_text.snippet_html: Edit 3: 2X alarms in last 10 days and now they are investigating "sensitivity" of fire alarms according to management email. Persistent issue since last year and yet they do not care. …

review_text.full_html:
Wanted to provide some neutral reviews. I’ve lived at Revela almost half year now. Overall experience is ok. Would I stay here when my lease expires? Prolly not considering the price.

Pros: new and safe property, nice pool and courtyard areas. Nice and friendly staff. Decent discount when I moved in. Valet living service ($25 monthly fee) which helps with taking care of my garbage so I don’t have to go out during pandemic.

Cons: you will hear every single footstep from upstairs. Also if your bedroom is close to the bathroom, you will also hear the water noise when upstairs using the bath tub.

Fire alarm went off every single month and last for around 10 min on average. Prolly will have more during the summer. The fire alarm issue could be caused by residents when they cook something really smoky. Management can only do this much.
review_text.snippet_html: Wanted to provide some neutral reviews. I’ve lived at Revela almost half year now. Overall experience is ok. Would I stay here when my lease expires? Prolly not considering the price. …

review_text.full_html: Not recommended

Horrible experience ! This place just look nice from outside. Once you move-in, you started to see how much issues living in this place.
- The heater never worked. The main HVAC unit is installed in bathroom, and it never seem to heat up the bedroom. In fact, bathroom is actually the only area that heats up. You would feel so cold at night sleeping here. The maintenance would keep come back and told you "everything works" and you keep feeling cold at night when setting temperature to 75 degree.

- The management never be upfront about how much the trash cost before you sign-up the lease. It would cost about $100 dollar on average per month. The valet trash has a limited pick-up time from 6-7 pm at night. Most people still at work or on the way home during that time. If you are a busy person, you would never see the benefit of that service. The management won't allow you to skip the service fee.

- Frequent fire alarm in the middle of the night. Management never informed us what caused the alarm. We are getting sick of have to wake up at 2 am and stay outside

- Unfriendly leasing office. For the amount of rent, we deserve better communication (not yelling just because small issue @ gym). These people should have find other job which are not related to public service.
review_text.snippet_html:
Horrible experience ! This place just look nice from outside. Once you move-in, you started to see how much issues living in this place.
- The heater never worked. The main HVAC unit is installed in bathroom, and it …

review_text.full_html:
[Updates on March 8, 2021] The situation is even worse than I wrote a few months ago. Since then, the fire alarm went on for like ~6 times. Every time the apartment staff would come up with a brand new excuse. And every time an alarm kicks off in midnight after they apologize and promise the problem is solved.

I don't understand why some other tenants/reviewers here do not think this is a serious issue (if you are not making money out of it of course). It has become an extremely dangerous situation because some people have become deaf to the alarms. I saw many neighbors just choose to stay in and ignore the alarms at this point. What if an actual fire starts someday?

[Original review]
Any comments that said the fire alarm issue is gone are lying and were potentially posted by apartment staff. We didn't move in to this place until very recently. One time (maybe less than a month ago), the alarm went off at 2AM in the morning and everybody had to evacuate. Today, the alarm went on and off many many times for half an hour. It is super annoying to live in my apartment and have to worry about when the next alarm will happen, especially because I have a dog.

It is hard to imagine how negligent the management is on the fire alarm issue. I only hope I could move out of this place as soon as possible.

review_text.full_html: Great apartments! Very clean and beautiful complex. The walls are really thick, I live here for 9 months now and never heard any sound from the other side. Management is very nice and always helpful. The Gym is great, they got everything you may need for a full training.

Super nice apartments in a prime location. Pardeep, Chelsea and Rachel were all very helpful in the leasing process and answered all the questions I had. I would highly recommend leasing from Revela if you're looking for beautiful modern apartments. I am looking forward to my move in date. Thanks again to the leasing staff!

Very nice and new apartments! High tech security and Nest thermostats and gorgeous appliances. Walk to the light rail station but that's about it, it's a little too far to walk to any stores/restaurants. Priced high due to newness and location... only complaint is that you can hear upstairs neighbors stomping around often and doors opening/closing from neighbors is loud.
review_text.snippet_html: Very nice and new apartments! High tech security and Nest thermostats and gorgeous appliances. Walk to the light rail station but that's about it, it's a little too far to walk to any stores/restaurants. Priced high due to newness and …

review_text.full_html: I really enjoyed dealing with the leasing agent Rachel Alonso, she was ever so helpful, responsive and attentive. I strongly recommend her if you are contemplating your move to Revela!

Dont live here especially if you have a dog or cat. Its really scary to even think about what would happen to my dog.

False fire alarm at least 5 times since I moved here (basically once a month at least). Its actually happening right now and I am standing outside the apartment and really annoyed about the situation.

We have a dog and every time this happens, our dog is in agony and going crazy because of the sound.

Can you imagine this happening to your dog while you are out? Management sends out an email with an excuse. Instead, what about you actually fix the situation?
review_text.snippet_html: Dont live here especially if you have a dog or cat. Its really scary to even think about what would happen to my dog. …

review_text.full_html: One of the best apartments I have ever lived at.  Happy with the location, community, and amenities.
Giving one start to this fire alarm issue. It has been several months, no one really care about residents' complain. We take rent and do nothing.

Revela community has great facilities like heated pool and jacuzzi, barbecue and cool formal and informal areas to gather with friends with outdoor fireplace and sofas to enjoy the nights out looking at the stars all year around.
Leasing office open 7 days a week means that you can get all the support you need, when you need it. It also comprises several party/office rooms with big screen TVs so that you can either entertain with movies or do a business presentation to an audience of about 12 people.
The community also has a well equipped gym and a great shared office space with several tables for group work or individual booths for additional privacy during focused work or phone meetings. This area has free Wifi from WaveG with decent speeds so that you can seamlessly move around between the shared office space and the pool when the meetings get boring.
Secured underground parking is available and comes included in most apartments but any extra parking space is going to cost you a premium $200/month (the same as a lease for a small car). Locationwise it's very nice with quick access to main roads, VTA and many companies at a 5-10 min walk. The apartments themselves have great areas, heating/cooling, very silent washer/dryer/dishwasher.
review_text.snippet_html: Revela community has great facilities like heated pool and jacuzzi, barbecue and cool formal and informal areas to gather with friends with outdoor fireplace and sofas to enjoy the nights out looking at the stars all year around. …

review_text.full_html:
The construction of phase 2 start at 7am everyday, very noisy, can not sleep at all.
Update: The noisy problem is handled quickly by the Revela leasing team, which is really helpful!

The staff at Revela are amazing. Everyone has been so nice and welcoming. They host regular events with food and drinks to create community and the property is beautiful.

I'm not from around here, so it's expensive (to me). For the price, I would have liked to see better quality finishes (plumbing, electric, floors, fire alarms that don't go off all the time ); they are definitely using builder grade materials where they can. The floor plan for my studio is well organized to maximize the space, though.

Overall, I'm quite happy with the place, location and amenities!
review_text.snippet_html: The staff at Revela are amazing. Everyone has been so nice and welcoming. They host regular events with food and drinks to create community and the property is beautiful. …

review_text.full_html: Very happy dealing with Katrina, the process was very smooth. Brand new property with great amenities, courteous stuff, and very close to MountainView light rail and Caltrain station. Definitely recommend leasing here.
THREE false fire alarms in mere TWO DAYS! This place is absurd. They'll torture you.

Revela has a lot of potential but as of right now I am rating 2 stars. I may upgrade later if the situation improves... Since we moved here in December the fire alarm has gone off at least 8 times. It always seems to be a false alarm but I have two dogs and I am not going to take any chances when it comes to their safety. The alarm is very loud and scares the dogs and has disrupted several important meetings we were trying to attend from home. Today the fire alarm went off again. I am recovering from surgery and walking the dogs down 4 flights of stairs while they are afraid of the loud alarm was a terrible experience, especially at a time when I need to be resting. After the fire department showed up and cleared the building I went back inside and the alarm went off yet again. The constant alarms are very disruptive and concerning.

The other issue is the construction next door. Whatever they are doing leaves a terrible odor in the air, it almost smells like something is burning but constantly for several months now. My partner who has never had allergies or breathing issues in the past has developed lung pain and trouble breathing since we moved here. We are certain that the construction is causing the issue and can't wait for it to be completed. For now we are running several air purifiers in the apartment to clean the air and wearing masks when we walk the dogs in the afternoon.

It's a shame to have to give Revela 2 stars because the building is very beautiful and the amenities are great. The complex hosts themed gatherings every month or so where they cater food and it creates a great opportunity to get to know our neighbors. I love that Revela does this! The staff in the office are great, very friendly, especially Lilly! I would love to be able to increase my rating in the future if the alarm situation is handled properly. When we first moved in we loved going for walks along the paths around the building, but the construction dust and terrible burning smell has ruined that recently. I can't wait for that portion of the construction to be finished.
review_text.snippet_html: Revela has a lot of potential but as of right now I am rating 2 stars. I may upgrade later if the situation improves... Since we moved here in December the fire alarm has gone off at least 8 times. It always seems to be a false alarm but I …

review_text.full_html: Fire alarms in this apartment are crazy. Management should seriously consider issuing refunds.
Apparently the management doesn't know how to keep the fire alarm under control. So many false alarms, which is unacceptable.
False fire alarms 4 times in 2 weeks. Don't live here if you value your sleep.
Great experience in leasing process. Lily is amazing, detail oriented and helped us throughout the process. Lily has provided one of the best experiences we had. Thanks
Lily is a wonderful manager! If you are looking new quite community, I would recommend to see Revela. They have good floor plans, great quality, some parks nearest on walking distance.
Living at Revela is like living at a resort! Amenities for every day of the week, wonderful, attentive staff, easy commute in any direction, and overall an amazing experience so far!
